name: Potato Bread Rolls
author: Rani
summary: A delicious way to use leftover mashed potatoes The recipe can be doubled, halved, or varied in other ways to suit the quantity of leftovers or your personal preference. These can be served with ketchup or any other dipping sauce.
directions: Heat one tablespoon of oil in a frying pan over medium high heat
Add the chopped onions, and saute until they are softened
Mix the turmeric and chili powder into the frying pan and remove the pan from the heat
Stir the mashed potatoes and cilantro into the frying pan; stir to mix well
Sprinkle a few drops of water onto each slice of bread
Spoon 1/4 of the potato mixture onto the slice of bread
Roll the bread into a cylinder
Seal the edges together by pinching the ends with your fingers, use more water if it is necessary to keep the bread sealed
Do the same with the remaining 3 slices of bread
Pour the three tablespoons of oil into a large frying pan or wok
Heat the oil to a high heat
Place  the bread rolls into the hot oil and fry until crispy
